ByVac - BV_Basic Items related to the older BV_Basic Tue, 11 May 2021 11:40:26 +0100 Phorum 5.2.18,397,397#msg-397 Python image conversion help (1 reply),397,397#msg-397
Bellow is part of my python script that gets image RGB and writes it out to the display using pil image lib.

I have two problems im stuck on ...

1). I can't find away to send image Height / width infomation in 16bit.

2). I am able to make out the image on the display but theres it is repeated three times and the colours are not correct.

any help or advice will be great , as im not getting any further with this.



import Image
import StringIO
import serial

ser = serial.Serial('COM20', 2000000)  

def send_image(image):
	pixels = image.load()
	ser.write('dicls\r\n')    # send cmd to accept image

	ser.write(chr(image.size[1]))      # send Height info
	ser.write(chr(image.size[0]))		 # send width info

	for y in xrange(image.size[1]):
		for x in xrange(image.size[0]):
			(r, g, b) = pixels[x, y]
			result = (r) |(g) |(b)

[Libreoffice] [bug fdo#41326] UI: Impossible to select text from the input line in a read-only document

Noel Grandin noelgrandin at gmail.com
Sat Jan 21 11:35:57 PST 2012

Yes, that's why we need to develop patches.
See here if you want to help:

On Sat, Jan 21, 2012 at 14:20, Rob Snelders <programming at ertai.nl> wrote:
> Hi All,
> I had the same problem as the people in this bug. Isn't it possible to
> enable the feature to select text in Read-Only-documents by default? I think
> it will help a lot of people when opening documents from, for example,
> email.
> --

again the results of a bulk build for pkgsrc-2005Q4 for
NetBSD/alpha 2.1 has been uploaded and merged in

This time a total of 36MB of package binaries have been uploaded,
mostly caused by Postgres and resulting upgrades.

The source this was built from was updated February 27th 2006.

From: Andrea.Pasetti
Subject: Make detects warning as errors
Date: Thu, 24 Nov 2011 17:05:59 +0100

In some projects (but not in all) when i compile it make detects warning as
errors and stops the build, but i dont' want this!
Can someone help me, plase?

I'm using GNU make 3.81 and below a compile LOG:

From Knut Anders Hatlen <knut.hat...@oracle.com>
Subject Re: [URGENT] Critical test situation on trunk
Date Wed, 08 Feb 2012 08:44:47 GMT
Rick Hillegas <rick.hillegas@oracle.com> writes:

> On 2/7/12 8:38 AM, Knut Anders Hatlen wrote:
>> Rick Hillegas<rick.hillegas@oracle.com>  writes:
>>> My last checkin (1241479) re-enabled NativeAuthenticationServiceTest
>>> on non-windows platforms. If the *nix tests fall over again tonight,
>>> then we should disable NativeAuthenticationServiceTest again until we
>>> understand the situation better.
>> Hi Rick,
>> I just gave the test a try with Java 5 on Solaris, and it seems to get
>> stuck in the fifth configuration (consistently). No problems with Java 6
>> or Java 7. Do you have any theories on why it behaves differently on
>> Java 5?
>> Thanks,
> Hi Knut,
> Thanks for running the test on other platforms. I don't know what is
> special about that configuration. I have instrumented the test to
> produce a fair amount of chatty output if you set
> -Dderby.tests.debug=true. If you set that flag and run on Java 5 on
> Solaris, we may get some clue about the problem from looking at the
> last statements printed to the console before the test hangs.

I'll take a look. The latest test cycle (with the test re-enabled)
passed on all platforms with Java 6 (including Windows). With Java 5,
the tests only passed on Windows. No Java 5 results were reported from
the Solaris and Linux variants.

Does the test pass with Java 5 in your (OS/X) environment?

Knut Anders

use an '='

(The <- operator is used for monadic computations and list

        x <- readFile ...


    mapFst xs = [ x | (x,y) <- xs ]

403 error on install
Posted: 28 March 2012 12:38 AM
Joined: 2011-11-28
37 posts


I have finally dug in and started witing my code on my development server.  In unzipped CI to my web root on my WAMP server, in a directory called tscs, I took the application folder out of the system folder. When I browse to my localhost directory/tscs/application/welcome.php I get the following ugly message:


You don’t have permission to access /tscs/application/welcome.php on this server.

What have I done wrong?  I’m just trying to get set up to do Hello World so I can start developing my site.  I know this is a real newbie question, I am a newbie, but I would greatly appreciate your guidance on helping me get up and running.


Posted: 28 March 2012 01:32 AM   [ # 1 ]   [ Rating: 0 ]
Joined: 2011-11-28
37 posts

I went back and did a fresh install into a dummy directory on my local webroot.  I went into the view folder and added a little code to the welcome message view, and it works. Apparently my problem stems from my altering the directory structure.  I’ve been watching tuts and guess I didn’t pay close enough attention to what needed to be done.
